chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: &product; is a collaborative software suite that runs in a web portal. It provides a rich set of tools that facilitate working in groups:

listitem.para: Shared and private workspaces, with built-in versioning
Real-time instant messaging and conferencing
Collaborative authoring tools (wikis, blogs, and threaded discussions) with logging
RSS and email subscriptions so users can be notified of updates
Social networking features (tags, content ratings)

chapter.para: The following main sections contain the basic information you need to start using &product;:

sect1.title: Getting Started
sect1.para: When you first start using &product;, you will see four portlets: &product; Navigator, the &product; Welcome portlet, an empty Buddy list portlet, and an empty Bookmarks portlet.
The following topics show you howe to get started using &product;:

sect2.title: Find your way around with the Navigator
sect2.para: The &product; Navigator is your navigation center.
Using the tools here, you can navigate to anyplace that you need to go:

listitem.para:
My workspace icon
My workspace - Click to open your personal workspace, which contains your folders, your profile, your Guestbook, and your Dashboard.

Favorites icon
Favorites - Click to open the Favorites menu, where you can add links to folders that you access frequently . From this menu, you can bookmark the current folder or workspace, navigate to any of the places that you bookmarked previously, and edit your bookmark list. (See Use Favorites for places you visit often on page 12.)
Quick Search - Enter any type of search term in the Quick search box and click to display a Quick search folder with the search results.

note.para: For more search options, click Advanced.

listitem.para:
Find people, Find Places, Find tags - Use these boxes to search for a user's personal workspace, for a workspaces and folders, or for

items with tags. (See Glossary.)

Workspace Tree - Click the plus sign to the left of the workspace tree icon
Workspace tree icon
to expand the workspace tree:

The tree has three main branches: Global, Personal and Teams. Expand one of these categories and "drill down" until you get to the workspace you need. To collapse a branch, click the minus sign to the left of the branch:
Workspace tree icon expanded

Help - Click to enter Help mode, then click on one of the help icons
that appear to access context-sensitive help. To exit Help mode, click Exit Help mode, or click anywhere except on another help icon.

sect2.title: Explore the Welcome Portlet
sect2.para: The Welcome portlet provides links to &product; help topics and the &product; user guides in PDF format.
If you remove this portlet, you can get it back by clicking Add Content at the top of your screen and selecting Welcome from the &product; menu.

sect2.title: Buddy List
sect2.para: Your Buddy List helps you keep track of people that you'll need to contact frequently. Add people to your buddy list right away to make it easy to get in touch with them.

step.para: Click Add buddies.
Start typing a name in either the Users or the Groups box. A dropdown list displays matching names. Select a name and click Apply to add the name to your list.
Add as many names as you want, clicking Apply after each one.
To remove a name, click the x icon after the name; then click Apply.
When you finish, click Close.

sect3.title: Tips for using your buddy list

listitem.para: The icon to the left of a buddy name indicates presence.
Online
Away
Offline
Unknown status
To communicate with a buddy, click his or her presence icon and select an option from the menu that appears.
To update presence information, click Refresh.
To view a buddy's contact information or to navigate to his or her workspace, click the buddy's name.

sect3.title: Folder Bookmarks Portlet
sect3.para: The Folder bookmarks portlet is a tool to help you keep track of updates to important folders. You can select which folders you want to watch, and you can display the number of unread entries in each. This tool is displayed on the sign-in page, so you can attend to any issues in the displayed folders immediately. If there are unread entries, you can open the folder to read them by clicking the folder name:

sect1.title: Configuring Your Workspace
sect1.para: The following procedures show you how to configure your &product; workspace:

sect2.title: Add info and a photo to your profile

step.para:
In the Navigator, click
My workspace icon
My workspace to go to your personal workspace.
On the menu bar for your workspace, click Modify profile.
Fill in any missing information. This information is visible to others and is also used by &product; and Zon to contact you by phone, email, or instant messaging.
Add a picture. Click Browseâ¦ to look for a graphics file on your computer.
Click OK to close the form.
The information is updated, and the picture is displayed in the Photo box of your profile.

sect2.title: Remove an image from your profile

step.para: To remove an image from your profile, click Modify profile.
Select the check box next to each image you want to delete.
Click OK. The images are removed.

sect3.title: Tips for adding photos to your profile

listitem.para: You can add as many images as you like, but you must add them one-by-one.

Thumbnails of all of your images are displayed beneath your contact information. As you move the mouse over a thumbnail, the image is displayed in the Photo box. To replace the original image in the Photo box with one of your other images, click on the image thumbnail.
To add a picture from the Internet, first save it to your computer.

sect1.title: Creating Content
sect1.para: The following topics show you how create content in &product;:

sect2.title: Folder types
sect2.para: &product; workspaces can contain a wide range of content. A unique feature of &product; is that it provides a variety of folder types, each designed for a particular type of content. For example, &product; has specially designed folders for wikis, blogs, discussion forums, file folders, and calendars, to name just a few.

sect2.title: Blogs
sect2.para: A blog is an online journal in whose entries are displayed in reverse chronological order (newest on top). It differs from wikis and discussion forums in that it generally written by a single author, with comments by members of his or her reading audience.

sect3.title: Start a blog in your workspace

step.para:
Click
My workspace icon
My workspace to display your personal workspace.
On the workspace menu bar, click Manage this workspace.
Select Add new folder. A form for adding a folder appears.
In the Title field, enter a title for your blog.
Under Select a template, choose Blog folder.
Click OK to create the blog.
On the menu bar above the blog calendar, click New and select Blog entry.
In the entry form that appears, enter the title of your blog entry in the Title box.
In the Description box, enter the content of your blog entry, using the rich formatting tools in the editor.
Click OK to add the entry to your blog.

sect2.title: Add a comment to a blog entry
sect2.para: Comments are a way to give feedback to a blog author.

step.para:
Click the
icon beneath the blog entry.
In the form that appears, enter the title of your blog comment in the Title box.
Enter your comment in the Description box.
Click OK. Your comment appears below the blog entry.

sect2.title: Rate an entry in a blog, wiki, or discussion
sect2.para: Another way that readers can provide feedback to authors is to rate entries on a scale of 1 to 5. By rating entries, you are making it easier for other users to focus on the most useful content.

step.para: View an entry in a blog, wiki, or discussion folder
Drag the mouse over the rating stars above the entry to highlight the desired number of stars (1 to 5).
Click to register your rating. The average rating and the number of ratings are updated immediately.

sect2.title: Work with teams
sect2.para: &product; was designed to facilitate teamwork. Create a team workspace; then add folders and a team to the workspace. Once your team is set up, you can communicate easily with your team members.

step.para: In the Navigator, click on the workspace tree to expand it.
Click on the Teams branch of the workspace tree.
On the Teams tab that appears, click Manage this workspace.
Select Add new workspace.
In the Title field, enter the name for your new workspace.
Click OK. The new workspace is added to Teams.

sect3.title: Add folders to the team workspace
sect3.para: For each folder that you want to add:

step.para: Click on Manage this workspace.
Click Add new folder.
In the form that appears, enter a name in the Title field and select the template for the folder that you want to add ( Discussion, Blog folder, Calendar folder, etc.)
Click OK. The folder is added to the workspace.

sect3.title: Add a team to a workspace or folder:

step.para: On the tab for the folder or workspace, click Access control.
Change the setting for Inherit role membership from the parent folder or workspace to No and click Apply.
In the Roles table, select Team Member for every user (or group of users) that you want to add to the team.
If a user is not shown in the Roles table, click Add a user. Begin typing the user name and select the name from the dropdown list. Then click Team Member for that user.
When you have finished adding members, click Save changes, then Close.
Select the workspace or folder with which the team is associated.
On the menu bar, click Team.
Click View members.

note.para: Notice that, as in your buddy list, presence icons are using to indicate the online and availability status of your team members.

step.para: On the menu bar, click Team.
Click Create a meeting. The Add meeting form appears.
Click Select all to create a meeting with all team members, or select the individual members to invite.
Click Start meeting to start a meeting immediately, or click Schedule to arrange a meeting in the future.
5. On the menu bar, click Team.
Click Send mail to members. The Send email form appears:
To send mail to all team members, click Select all.
Fill in the Subject and Message.
Click OK to send the message. The message contains a link back to your workspace.

sect3.title: Tips for working with teams
sect3.para: When setting up teams, begin at the top-most workspace or folder. Then allow workspaces and folders below that to inherit role membership.

sect2.title: Use Favorites for places you visit often
sect2.para: The following procedures show you how to start using favorites in ICEcorps.

sect3.title: To add a place to Favorites:

step.para: Navigate to the workspace or folder that you want to add to your Favorites list.

Click
Favorites icon
to open the Favorites menu.
Click Bookmark this place. The workspace or folder is added at the end of the Favorites list.

sect3.title: To return to one of your Favorites:

step.para:
Click
Favorites icon
to open the Favorites menu.
Click on the name of a place that you previously added to the Favorites list.

sect3.title: To delete one or more Favorites from your list:

step.para: From the Favorites menu, click Edit Favorites.
Select each of the places to delete.
Click Delete, then OK. The places are removed from your Favorites list.
Close the Favorites menu.

sect3.title: To change the order of the items in your Favorites list:

step.para: From the Favorites menu, click Edit Favorites.
Select one or more items in the list.
Click Down or Up to move the selected items down or up.
When you finish, click OK.
Close the Favorites menu.

sect2.title: Tagging
sect2.para: Tagging is a powerful way to discover, evaluate, and retrieve information. Users assign keywords, called tags, to workspaces, folders, and entries. Tags are designated as either community (shared) or personal (private). You can then use tags in searches. The search engine also uses tags to rank search results by relevance.

sect3.title: To add tags to a workspace, folder, or entry:

step.para:
Start in the place that you want to tag. Any tags already assigned to this place are displayed below the
Tags icon
icon.

Click
Tags icon
to open the Add/Delete Tags form. Any previously assigned tags are also listed here.

In either the Personal tags or Shared tags text box, type the new tag and click Add. As you type, a dropdown list displays existing tags that match the letters in the box. When you click Add, the tag is added to the list of tags assigned to this place.

When you finish adding tags, close the Add/Delete Tags form by clicking the x in the upper right corner of the form. You will now see the new tags below the
Tags icon
icon.

sect3.title: To remove tags from a place:

step.para:
Click
Tags icon
to open the Add/Delete Tags form.
Click Delete for every tag that you want to delete.

When you finish deleting tags, close the Add/Delete Tags form by clicking the x in the upper right corner of the form. The tags that you deleted are removed from the list of tags beneath the
Tags icon
icon.

sect3.title: To use tags in a search:

step.para: In the Find tags box in the Navigator, start typing the personal or shared tag that you want to search for. As you type, a dropdown list displays tags that match the letters that you've typed.
Finish typing the tag (or select it from the list) and press Enter.
A new tab appears, containing a summary of every item to which the tag was assigned. You can skim the results, and open any items that look interesting.

sect2.title: Relevance Rankings
sect2.para: When you perform a Quick or Advanced search, the top-ranked places (folders) and people (authors) are displayed in descending order of popularity on the left side of the search results page. The brightness of the star to the left of an item in the list indicates the relative ranking of the place or author.

listitem.para: Tags are case-sensitive. This means that Internet, internet, and INTERNET are all separate tags.
Tags are single words that cannot contain punctuation marks, underscores, hyphens, or spaces.

Avoid adding personal tags that are identical to shared tags. When you use Find tags to search for a personal tag that is the same as a shared tag, the search results return both sets of items, which may be confusing.
Use Advanced Search to:
search for multiple tags
use mixed search criteria (for example, to search by Author and by Tags in the same search)
search only for shared tags or only for personal tags.

The tag cloud (weighted list of tags) displayed in the Quick Search and Advanced Search results shows tags associated with the first 200 items returned by the search. The type size of the tags indicates their relative frequency of use.

glossdef.para: A list of people that you contact frequently.
An item, such as a wiki topic, file, or photo, that is contained in a folder.
A container for entries and other folders. Each folder has a type, such as blog, wiki, or calendar, that determines its appearance and features.
The state of being connected to a communications service and available for communication. Presence information is indicated by status icons.
A keyword that anyone can add to a place to make it easier to find that and related places. Community tags are shared. Personal tags are private.
A weighted list of tags in which frequently used tags are displayed in larger type.
A container for folders and other workspaces.
